channel.title: This account is old can I change my username please
channel.description: This account is rather a bit old can i change my username?

item.title: This account is old can I change my username please
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:17, topic:524548”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=643099.msg4330465#msg4330465 date=1373575891]

They will refuse to change it. Something that a lot of members would want but because they won’t listen to our suggestions and treat adding a new thing as if it’s going to ruin the site.

If an exception is made for one person, everyone else will request it too. Furthermore, I wouldn’t want someone to suddenly change usernames, as they have already established an “identity” here. Minor edits to a name seem okay to me, but not a complete name change.

Allow a name change once every decade and my previous suggestion would of covered identity by doing what jagex did and have “lastly known as” type thing going on. I don’t know why you would care to follow somebody anyway. The search bar is also there if you’re looking for something!

Would you change your IRL name once a decade?
[/quote]
It happens a lot to people under witness protection program.

I recommend you read this: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-15333140 there’s a couple reasons for you :)[/quote]

Would you?

Read full topic

item.source: This account is old can I change my username please

item.title: This account is old can I change my username please
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:16, topic:524548”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=643099.msg4330456#msg4330456 date=1373575695]

They will refuse to change it. Something that a lot of members would want but because they won’t listen to our suggestions and treat adding a new thing as if it’s going to ruin the site.

If an exception is made for one person, everyone else will request it too. Furthermore, I wouldn’t want someone to suddenly change usernames, as they have already established an “identity” here. Minor edits to a name seem okay to me, but not a complete name change.

Allow a name change once every decade and my previous suggestion would of covered identity by doing what jagex did and have “lastly known as” type thing going on. I don’t know why you would care to follow somebody anyway. The search bar is also there if you’re looking for something!
[/quote]

Would you change your IRL name once a decade?[/quote]
If you didn’t like it and had a reason to, it is within legal boundaries to do so. If he no longer smokes and does not wish to be affiliated with smoking then why not let him change his name to something similar? Something like Dawsongames or something doesn’t seem like such a horrible thing. I know that if my account was Elrick420YOLO and I realized I was an idiot for making it that, I would ask that my name be changed to Elrick or Elrick240 or something.

However, Dawson your account is only a year old, so why not just make a new account with a similar name? I can understand if you had joined when the community had just started, but you could always just link your now profile in your signature or info of your new account should you decide to make one.

Read full topic
item.source: This account is old can I change my username please

item.source: This account is old can I change my username please

item.title: This account is old can I change my username please
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

dawsonsmokes:

Well I will see what I can do then I suppose wish they would actually contribute more to us since we pretty much keep their forums up and going if it wasn’t for the people who registered how else would they keep it running right lol

Sort of. It’s the key contributing members that keep the foundation of the community strong. Without their releases, there would be no reason to visit the site. They should contribute more? Not really. Just be grateful that we have a central hub to exchange ideas (this concept seems to have been lost in time). Staff are volunteer and Mopar isn’t forced to allow us this.
The staff generally only allow name changes for the higher profile members.
So far, you’re not one of them.

Side note: Criticizing management when you’re relatively new isn’t the best way to go about fitting in or progressing a positive reputation.

Read full topic
